<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> GUI Control

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Displays text across the screen. If used along with [[cutText]] two different texts (in different type styles) can be shown at once. The text can be displayed on multiple lines by using "\n" new line characters:
<tt>[[titleText]] ["line1\nline2\nline3", "PLAIN"];</tt>. Since Arma 3 v1.73.142260 this command supports [[Structured Text]] formatting.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''titleText''' [text, type, speed,  showInMap, isStructuredText]

</value></part><part><name>p1 </name>=<value> [text, type, speed, showInMap, isStructuredText]: [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> text: [[String]] - text to be displayed

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> type: [[String]] one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [[Title Effect Type]]s for more information about these values.
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> speed (Optional): [[Number]] - Time in seconds to fade in resource. Default: -1
</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> showInMap (Optional): [[Boolean]] - [[false]] to hide the text when the map is opened. Default: [[true]]
</value></part><part><name>p6</name>=<value> isStructuredText (Optional): [[Boolean]] - [[true]] to switch support for [[Structured Text]] formatting. Default: [[false]] (See Example 3. Available since Arma 3 v1.73.142260)

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[titleText]] ["Show this text", "PLAIN"];</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[titleText]] ["Your message", "BLACK", 2];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value>Since Arma 3 v1.73.142260:<code>[[titleText]] ["&lt;t color='#ff0000' size='5'>RED ALERT!&lt;/t>&lt;br/>***********", "PLAIN", -1, [[true]], [[true]]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[titleFadeOut]], [[cutText]], [[cutObj]], [[allActiveTitleEffects]]
</value></part></template>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 21, 2014 - 09:03 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:DreadedEntity|DreadedEntity]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The third parameter or 'speed', as it is called in the description, refers to the amount of time the message will be shown on-screen. Multiply each number by 10 to get the number of seconds it will be shown. You can even use floats as input, like 0.1, to show a message for only 1 second.<br><br>

'''Note''': Calculating the time with that method does not include the time it takes to fade in/out, which is about 1 second unless you use numbers lower than 1.<br>
'''Note''': Using anything lower than 0.001 seems to have no effect, or the effect is so little it is negligible.<br>
'''(A3 1.34.128075)'''
</dd>
</dl>
